channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Home Depot exec says Americans may soon embrace sky-high mortgage rates as ‘the new normal’ and invest in housing anyway
item.description: Historic mortgage rates show today’s rates are more "normal" than they were just a few decades ago.

item.title: German Central Bank Loss Points to More Economic Woes for Germany
item.description: The central bank’s president said it was “not possible to rule out” a third year of no economic growth.

item.title: German Central Bank Loss Points to More Economic Woes for Germany
item.description: The central bank’s president said it was “not possible to rule out” a third year of no economic growth.

item.title: Anxious Prayers as Pope Francis Lingers in Critical Condition
item.description: Eleven days after the pope was hospitalized, speculation is mounting and prayers for his recovery verge on a vigil.

item.title: Trump’s threat to EV trucking rules undermines big-rig bets
item.description: The darkening landscape for EV rules is a blow to businesses that have poured gobs of money into California’s expected clean-energy transition.

item.title: Goldman says U.S. households to pay $170 if oil tariffs imposed
item.description: Analysts said that a 10% U.S. tariff on crude oil would not significantly boost U.S. production.

item.title: AI is everywhere except in worker productivity stats
item.description: It looks like a return to Solow's Paradox as CEO views of AI's advantage diverge.

item.title: The World Bank Pivoted to Climate. That Now May Be a Problem.
item.description: The Trump administration’s deep cuts to clean-energy programs are raising concerns about U.S. commitments to the lender.

item.title: Is Bird Flu the Only Reason Egg Prices Are Soaring?
item.description: The nation’s biggest egg producer has seen rising revenues and profits. Now some Democrats are calling for an investigation into pricing practices in ...

item.title: Their Album Is Wordless. Will Their Protest Against A.I. Resound?
item.description: Musicians including Kate Bush and Billy Ocean released a “silent record” in outrage at a proposed change to British copyright law.

item.title: Syria Begins National Dialogue but Without Kurdish-Led Militia
item.description: Although the conference was called to chart the country’s future, the Kurdish-led militia that controls much of Syria’s northeast was not invited.

item.title: James Carville: The Best Thing Democrats Can Do in This Moment
item.description: There’s nothing Democrats can legitimately do to stop Trump, so we need a tactical pause in our fight to plan for the future.

item.title: Supreme Court Grants New Trial to Death Row Inmate in Oklahoma
item.description: Both sides had told the justices that long-suppressed evidence had undermined the case against the inmate, Richard Glossip.

item.title: The federal funding freeze is inciting fear and chaos for millions with cancer. There’s a better way
item.description: Uncertainty for people with cancer can mean delayed care, missed appointments, and strain that results in worse health outcomes.

item.title: White House Moves to Pick the Pool Reporters Who Cover Trump
item.description: In announcing plans to handpick the reporters who can ask the president questions, the White House is breaking decades of precedent.
